CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C01

TI_TEXT.P: Υπηρεσίες παροχής συμβουλών για θέματα που αφορούν κατασκευές
Servicios de consultoría en materia de edificios
Servizi di consulenza per la costruzione
Serviços de consultoria relacionados com edifícios
Servicii de consultanţă în domeniul imobiliar

TITLE.P: Design team for a new library for the University of Bristol.

SHORT_DESCR.P: It is the intention of The University of Bristol to use the Restricted Procedure to appoint a fully integrated design team for the design and delivery of a new University Library.
It is intended that the fully integrated design team will comprise of:
— Architects
— M&E Engineers
— Civil & Structural Engineers
The University also intends to make separate appointments via the Restricted Procedure for:
— Project Manager
— Quantity Surveyor / Cost Manager

It is the intention of the University that the fully integrated design team will be led by the Architect, with the Architect also undertaking the CDM Principal Designer duties. Consultants interested in responding to the design team element are required to respond to this procurement exercise as a complete design team.

No response / expression of interest is required at this stage; this Notice is solely to provide prior and clear notification to the market of the University's intentions and the intended structure of the appointments.

TITLE.P: Integrated Design Team (Architects, M&E Engineers, Civil & Structural Engineers)

SHORT_DESCR.P: This Notice is to notify the market that the University of Bristol intends to run procurement exercises to appoint a consultant team for the design and delivery of a new University Library.

The University intends to use the Restricted Procedure to appoint a fully integrated design team, shortlisting at the first stage based on prior experience before selecting the winning consultants based on detailed technical proposals.
It is intended that the fully integrated design team will comprise of:
— Architects
— M&E Engineers
— Civil & Structural Engineers

It is the intention of the University that the design team will be led by the Architect, with the Architect also undertaking the CDM Principal Designer duties. Consultants interested in responding will be required to respond to the procurement exercise as a complete design team.
The University also intends to make separate appointments via the Restricted Procedure for:
— Project Manager
— Quantity Surveyor / Cost Manager.

INFO_ADD.P: No response/expression of interest is required by suppliers at this stage.
This Notice is solely to provide prior and clear notification to the market of the University's intentions and the intended structure of the appointments.
It is anticipated that the Contract Notice and tender documentation will be published in May or June 2017, via the University's e-tendering portal tenders.bris.ac.uk

TITLE.P: Quantity Surveyor / Cost Consultant for new library design team

SHORT_DESCR.P: This Notice is to notify the market that the University of Bristol intends to run procurement exercises to appoint a consultant team for the design and delivery of a new University Library.

The University intends to use the Restricted Procedure to appoint a Quantity Surveyor / Cost Consultant. Shortlisting at the first stage will be based on prior experience, before the winning consultants are selected based on detailed technical proposals.
The University also intends to make separate appointments via the Restricted Procedure for:
— Project Manager
— Fully integrated design team (Architects, M&E Engineers, Civil & Structural Engineers).

INFO_ADD.P: No response/expression of interest is required by suppliers at this stage.
This Notice is solely to provide prior and clear notification to the market of the University's intentions and the intended structure of the appointments.
It is anticipated that the Contract Notice and tender documentation will be published in May or June 2017, via the University's e-tendering portal tenders.bris.ac.uk

TITLE.P: Project Manager for new library design team

SHORT_DESCR.P: This Notice is to notify the market that the University of Bristol intends to run procurement exercises to appoint a consultant team for the design and delivery of a new University Library.

The University intends to use the Restricted Procedure to appoint a Project Manager. Shortlisting at the first stage will be based on prior experience, before the winning consultants are selected based on detailed technical proposals.
The University also intends to make separate appointments via the Restricted Procedure for:
— Quantity Surveyor / Cost Manager
— Fully integrated design team (Architects, M&E Engineers, Civil & Structural Engineers).

INFO_ADD.P: No response/expression of interest is required by suppliers at this stage.
This Notice is solely to provide prior and clear notification to the market of the University's intentions and the intended structure of the appointments.
It is anticipated that the Contract Notice and tender documentation will be published in May or June 2017, via the University's e-tendering portal tenders.bris.ac.uk

The construction of a new library is included as one of the principal objectives of the University strategy for 2016 to 2023. The library is expected to be 10 000-11 000 m2 of gross space, with potential for further expansion. Full details will be provided with the tender documentation, including clear guidance on the way that we envisage the new library would operate.
Tenderers will be required to demonstrate previous experience of delivering similar projects, and propose their design team as part of their tender response.

The University reserves the right to make any changes to the procurement as it may require at any time with no liability on its part (including to change, suspend, stop or terminate the process and not award a contract and/or to reject any or all bids at any time).
As stated above, interested parties are not required to respond to this PIN or submit any Expression of Interest at this time. A Contract Notice will be issued in due course.
